thread.title: Reaction to Butler's win: 'Singing in enemy territory'
thread.title_full: Reaction to Butler's win: 'Singing in enemy territory'

author: scott.horner@indystar.com
title: Reaction to Butler's win: 'Singing in enemy territory'
text:
Reaction to Butler's win: 'Singing in enemy territory' Scott Horner , scott.horner@indystar.com Published 11:57 p.m. ET Feb. 22, 2017 | Updated 10 hours ago CLOSE Share Butler Insider David Woods recaps upset of No. 2 Villanova. David Woods/IndyStar Butler forward Kelan Martin (30) chases a rebound during the second half of the team's NCAA college basketball game against Villanova, Wednesday, Feb. 22, 2017, in Villanova, Pa. Butler won 74-66. (AP Photo/Laurence Kesterson) (Photo: Laurence Kesterson, AP) 427 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Dawgs used an 18-0 second-half run to pull ahead. 
Villanova's seniors had never lost on their on-campus court. 
Butler pulled the season sweep over the defending national champs, who were No. 1 and 2 at the time of Butler's wins. 
So, yeah, people took notice. Singing in enemy territory! Not much better than that. pic.twitter.com/9e3q5mloGx — Butler Basketball (@ButlerMBB) February 23, 2017 Great day to be a dawg! — Tyler Lewis (@ty1ewis) February 23, 2017 Great win — Shelvin Mack (@ShelvinMack) February 23, 2017 Remember that time we were 10 point underdogs? Good times — Roosevelt Jones (@rozayyjones21) February 23, 2017 Fun fact: @chrabascz45 with 8 assists tonight. Nova as a team: 8 assists. Making winning plays. #Dawgs — Matt Howard (@MHoward54) February 23, 2017 BUTLER BULLDOGS!!!
